IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To enable our residents to enjoy the gifts of independence, good health, and personal fulfillment to the fullest extent possible through Lenbrook's many programs and services.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MISSION: TO ENABLE OUR RESIDENTS TO ENJOY THE GIFTS OF INDEPENDENCE, GOOD HEALTH, AND PERSONAL FULFILLMENT TO THE FULLEST EXTENT POSSIBLE THROUGH LENBROOK'S MANY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. VISION: TO BE RECOGNIZED AS THE MOST DESIRABLE SENIOR LIVING COMMUNITY IN THE SOUTHEAST. THIS IS BECAUSE LENBROOK LEADS THE WAY BY PROVIDING OUTSTANDING RESIDENT SERVICES AND AWARD WINNING FACILITIES UNIQUELY ALIGNED TO ENRICH AND FULFILL THE DIVERSE NEEDS OF A VIBRANT ADULT COMMUNITY IN ONE ELEGANT SETTING.
IRS990.Desc: GENERAL OPERATION OF CONTINUING CARE FACILITY PROVIDING HOUSING AND SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY, AVERAGING 446 RESIDENTS PER DAY. THE COMMUNITY INCLUDES A 17-STORY BUILDING CONTAINING 209 RESIDENTIAL UNITS, 16 PERSONAL CARE UNITS, A 24-STORY BUILDING CONTAINING 140 RESIDENTIAL UNITS AND A 60-BED SKILLED NURSING CARE UNIT, A 5-STORY BUILDING CONTAINING 39 RESIDENTIAL UNITS AND 14 RESIDENCES IN 3 SEPARATE VILLAS, ALONG WITH VARIOUS ADMINISTRATIVE, DINING AND RECREATIONAL AMENITIES.

USAddress.AddressLine1Txt: 235 PONCE DE LEON PLACE STE M-310

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO ENHANCE RESIDENT ENGAGEMENT AND QUALITY OF LIFE. THEY MAY ALSO BE USED FOR ASSOCIATE EDUCATION AND HARDSHIP.

LENBROOK IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. LENBROOK'S WHOLLY-OWNED SUBSIDIARY, MENDERS, PAYS INCOME TAXES BASED ON REPORTED INCOME BEFORE INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT A PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR INCOME TAXES IS NOT SIGNIFICANT THROUGH JUNE 30, 2022. THE FOUNDATION ANNUALLY EVALUATES ALL FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX POSITIONS. THIS PROCESS INCLUDES AN ANALYSIS OF WHETHER THESE INCOME TAX POSITIONS THE FOUNDATION TAKES MEET THE DEFINITION OF AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION UNDER THE INCOME TAXES TOPIC OF THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION. IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF BUSINESS, THE FOUNDATION IS SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE FEDERAL AND STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES. IN GENERAL, THE FOUNDATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR THE TAX YEARS ENDING BEFORE JUNE 30, 2019.

ASSOCIATE EDUCATION AND ASSOCIATE HARDSHIP GRANTS: Associates must complete an application and eligibility review process. A committee of residents and staff/management approve the application. Funds are generally released directly to the educational institution or the vendor but under certain circumstances will be released to the individual to cover obligations. Resident Benevolence Grants: the CFO reviews and updates the resident's financial profile. The grant must be approved by the Board. Funds are transferred internally rather than released to the resident.

THE BOARD APPROVED FUNDING A DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN TO CERTAIN EMPLOYEES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 457(F). THIS PLAN IS IN PLACE TO RETAIN INDIVIDUALS KEY TO THE SUCCESSFUL OPERATIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE PLAN IS FUNDED ANNUALLY AND GRANTS VEST TO THE EMPLOYEE OVER A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS. AS THE GRANTS ARE FUNDED, THE FUNDED AMOUNT IS REPORTED AS NON-TAXABLE DEFERRED COMPENSATION ON FORM 990. TAXABLE COMPENSATION IS REPORTED TO THE EMPLOYEE ON FORM W-2 AND ON FORM 990 AS BALANCES IN THE PLAN VEST. CONTRIBUTIONS FOR THE CALENDAR YEAR 2021 TOTALED $450,000 TO THE PLAN. AT THIS TIME, NO AMOUNTS HAVE VESTED.
COMPENSATION-NON-FIXED PAYMENTS: THE ORGANIZATION PAID A BONUS TO CERTAIN OFFICERS AND HIGHLY COMPENSATED INDIVIDUALS REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: RES CARE FACIL FOR THE ELDERLY AUTH FULTON CTY GA

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART I, A: ISSUER NAME RESIDENTIAL CARE FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY AUTHORITY OF FULTON COUNTY (GEORGIA) COL. F: DESCRIPTION OF PURPOSE -CURRENTLY REFUND THE ORGANIZATION'S 2006A BONDS ISSUED ON 12/13/2006, AND ADVANCE REFUND THE ORGANIZATION'S 2006B BONDS ISSUED ON 12/13/2006.

PART II, LINE 3: TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUE AS OF 6/30/2022 ARE SALE PROCEEDS PLUS INVESTMENT PROCEEDS EARNED ON THE CURRENT REFUNDING ESCROW AND THE ADVANCE REFUNDING ESCROW AND TRANSFERRED PROCEEDS FROM THE DEBT SERVICE RESERVE FUND FOR THE 2006 BONDS, WHICH WERE USED TO REFUND THE 2006 BONDS.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS A SALON SERVICES AGREEMENT WITH A BEAUTY SALON PROVIDER. THE APPROXIMATE SPACE OCCUPIED BY THE PROVIDER RELATIVE TO THE TOTAL BOND-FINANCED PROPERTY IS LESS THAN 0.2%.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS DETERMINED THAT ITS MANAGEMENT OR SERVICE CONTRACTS MEET THE APPLICABLE SAFE HARBOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART III, LINE 9 PART V
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED WRITTEN SPECIFIC MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THE POST-ISSUANCE COMPLIANCE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT BOND LIABILITIES ON 12/4/2013 AND UPDATED THE PROCEDURES ON 10/1/2016.
A REBATE COMPUTATION WAS PERFORMED ON SEPTEMBER 22, 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 REVIEW PROCESS-FORM 990, PART VI, SEC B, LINE 11A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CFO, CEO, ACCOUNTING DIRECTOR AND MEMBERS OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. CHANGES ARE MADE, IF APPLICABLE, AND A COPY OF THE REVIEWED FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY-FORM 990, PART VI, SEC B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WHICH DEFINES A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, EXPLAINS HOW DISCLOSURE OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS SHOULD BE FACILITATED AND THE PROCEDURES TO MANAGE CONFLICTS. ANNUALLY, BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO REAFFIRM IN WRITING THEIR INTEREST TO CONTINUE ON THE BOARD AND THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF OUR CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND RECUSAL FORM IF THEY PERCEIVE THEY MAY HAVE A POTENTIAL CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: COMPENSATION POLICY-FORM 990, PART VI, SEC B, LINE 15A AND 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMPENSATION POLICY FOR OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES WHICH OUTLINES THE REVIEW AND APPROVAL PROCESS, THE USE OF COMPARABLE DATA AND THE RECORDING OF COMPENSATION DECISIONS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES RECOMMENDATIONS OF COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES, COMPARABLE MARKET DATA AND LENBROOK'S COMPENSATION PLAN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: INFORMATION AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC-FORM 990, PART VI, SEC C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES A COPY OF GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE BY ARRANGEMENT WITH THE INDIVIDUAL.

PART X, LINE 23 SECURED MORTGAGES AND NOTES PAYABLE TO UNRELATED THIRD PARTIES AT THE BEGINNING OF THE YEAR, INCLUDED LOANS RECEIVED UNDER THE SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION PAYCHECK PROTECTION PROGRAM (PPP) IN THE AMOUNTS OF $2,433,000 FOR LENBROOK SQUARE FOUNDATION AND $425,654 FOR LENBROOK'S WHOLLY-OWNED ENTITY, MENDERS BY LENBROOK, LLC. THE LOANS WERE SET UP TO FOLLOW REPAYMENT TERMS OUTLINED BY THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITIES ACT (CARES ACT) AND THE PAYCHECK PROTECTION PROGRAM FLEXIBILITY ACT (PPPFA). IN AUGUST 2022, LENBROOK AND MENDERS OBTAINED PPP LOAN FORGIVENESS AND REPORTED THE FUNDS ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 1E AS GOVERNMENT GRANTS (CONTRIBUTIONS).
